The euler angles are set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0577, 0.0]. 1.1 Sketching the rectangular prism face: Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 1.1.1 Draw a line from point (0.0865, 0.0) to point (0.6635, 0.0). 1.1.2 Draw an arc centered at (0.75, 0.0865) from point (0.6635, 0.0) to point (0.6635, 0.1731). 1.1.3 Draw a line from point (0.6635, 0.1731) to point (0.0865, 0.1731). 1.1.4 Draw an arc centered at (0.0, 0.0865) from point (0.0865, 0.1731) to point (0.0865, 0.0). 1.2 Scaling the 2D sketch: Scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.75. 1.3 Transforming the 2D sketch: Rotate the scaled 2D sketch by -90 degrees about the Z-axis of the coordinate system and translate it along the Y-axis by 0.0577. 1.4 Extruding the 2D sketch: Extrude the scaled and transformed sketch into a 3D part with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0577 units and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. 1.5 Drilling a cylindrical hole: In the same sketch, create a new closed loop using a circle with center (0.0865, 0.0865) and radius of 0.0346 units. 1.6 Extruding the cylindrical hole: Extrude the closed loop of the circle with the same extrusion depth towards the normal (0.0577 units). The rear faces should be trimmed by this operation, resulting in a cylindrical hole in the rectangular prism. With these instructions, the junior CAD designer will generate part 1: a rectangular metal prism with a cylindrical hole in one end. The height is 0.75 units, the width is 0.0577 units, and the length is 0.75 units.</description>
